Content:
I spent 6 hours grading my friend's interview practice answers.

She was preparing for a Product Manager role and asked me to review her 45 STAR method responses.

By question 12, I was exhausted. My feedback was getting less detailed. She deserved better.

So I built an AI Interview Coach that does what took me 6 hours in 5 minutes.

Here's how it works:

âœ… Candidate types their answer in Google Sheets
âœ… AI grades it against STAR methodology (Situation, Task, Action, Result)
âœ… Provides detailed feedback on what's missing
âœ… Generates an improved version for learning
âœ… All scores and feedback tracked automatically

The best part? It's objective and consistent. No "getting tired" by question 40.

Real results from my friend:
â†’ Instant feedback on 45 questions in 5 minutes
â†’ Clear scores showing which answers need work
â†’ Improved versions to learn from
â†’ Complete practice history to track progress

She landed the PM role last month. Said the consistent practice with instant feedback was a game-changer.

If you're helping someone prep for interviews (or prepping yourself), you shouldn't have to choose between thoroughness and your time.

Automation can be your practice partner that never gets tired.

---
Built with: n8n + OpenAI + Google Sheets
Time to build: ~4 hours
Time saved per practice session: 6+ hours

spent 6 hours grading my friend's interview answers last month

by question 12 i was exhausted and my feedback was getting worse

she deserved better so i built something

here's what i built:

an AI interview coach that grades practice answers using STAR method

â€¢ reads answers from google sheets

â€¢ gives detailed feedback
â€¢ generates improved versions
â€¢ tracks everything automatically

what took me 6 hours now takes 5 minutes

and it's consistent. no "getting tired" by question 40

she got the job last month ðŸŽ‰

same quality feedback for question 1 and question 45

if you're prepping for interviews, you need a practice partner that never gets tired

that's what automation is for

I was drowning in 40+ emails every single day.

Each one needed a thoughtful, professional response. But by 3 PM, I was burnt out and my replies were getting shorter and less helpful.

My inbox became my full-time job.

Then I realized: I was spending 3 hours daily writing emails that followed the same patterns.

So I built an AI Email Assistant that drafts my responses while I focus on actual work.

Here's the workflow:

âœ… Runs every hour automatically
âœ… Checks 3 Outlook folders for emails needing replies
âœ… AI reads each email and understands context
âœ… Generates professional draft response
âœ… Saves draft in Outlook for my review
âœ… Moves original to organized folder

What changed:

Before: 3 hours daily writing emails, stressed by 3 PM
After: 15 minutes reviewing/editing drafts, energy for real work

The AI doesn't replace me - it gives me back my time.

I still review every draft. Sometimes I edit, sometimes I send as-is. But I'm not starting from a blank screen 40 times a day.

Real impact:
â†’ 2-3 hours saved daily (that's 12+ hours per week)
â†’ Consistent professional tone across all emails
â†’ Never miss an email that needs response
â†’ More energy for strategic work

The best automation doesn't do your job. It removes the repetitive parts so you can do your job better.

---
Built with: n8n + Microsoft Outlook + OpenAI GPT-4o
Setup time: ~3 hours
Time saved weekly: 12+ hours

i was spending 3 hours EVERY DAY writing emails

40+ emails. all needing thoughtful replies. by 3pm i was done

2-3 hours saved DAILY
that's 12+ hours per week back

consistent professional tone

best automation doesn't replace you. it removes the repetitive stuff so you can focus on what matters

My client was losing $8,000/month because customers simply... forgot to pay.

Not refusing to pay. Not disputing invoices. Just forgetting.

She was manually sending payment reminders every week, but it was inconsistent. Some customers got 3 reminders, others got none.

The problem wasn't the customers. It was the process.

So we built an automated invoice reminder system that runs while she sleeps.

Here's what happens every morning at 9 AM:

âœ… System checks all pending invoices in Google Sheets
âœ… Filters for customers who haven't been reminded yet
âœ… Generates personalized email with customer name, amount, and payment link
âœ… Sends friendly reminder via Gmail
âœ… Updates spreadsheet to track which reminders were sent
âœ… Never sends duplicate reminders

The reminders are warm and professional - reflecting the brand voice, not robotic "pay us now" messages.

Results after 60 days:

â†’ Average payment time dropped from 45 to 23 days
â†’ $8,000+ in previously "forgotten" payments collected
â†’ 5 hours weekly saved on manual follow-ups
â†’ 0 duplicate reminders sent
â†’ Improved customer relationships (they appreciate the gentle reminder)

The best part? She hasn't manually sent an invoice reminder in 2 months.

Your cash flow problems might not be customer issues. Sometimes it's just a process problem.

And process problems? Those can be automated.

---
Built with: Zapier + Google Sheets + Gmail
Setup time: 2 hours
Monthly impact: $8,000+ in faster payments

my client was losing $8k/month

not because customers refused to pay

because they FORGOT

others got none

â€¢ all automatic

payment time: 45 days â†’ 23 days

5 hours/week saved
zero duplicate reminders

she hasn't manually sent a reminder in 2 months

your cash flow problem might not be customer problem

it might just be a process problem

and process problems can be automated

127 people commented on my client's Instagram post last Tuesday.

By the time she manually DM'd the first 8 people (3 hours later), 119 of them had already forgotten about her offer.

Cold leads. Wasted opportunity. Lost revenue.

She asked me: "How do I turn Instagram comments into actual bookings without spending 12 hours a day in DMs?"

So we built an Instagram Auto DM system that does the heavy lifting while she focuses on content.

Here's what happens automatically:

âœ… Someone comments on her post
âœ… System likes their comment instantly (social proof + engagement boost)
âœ… Sends personalized DM within seconds ("Hey [Name], loved your comment!")
âœ… Asks qualifying questions through interactive conversation
âœ… Identifies genuinely interested prospects vs. casual browsers
âœ… Sends booking link ONLY to qualified leads
âœ… Works 24/7 for both Instagram AND Facebook comments

The transformation was immediate.

Before automation:
â†’ Manually DM'ing 10-15 people took 4 hours
â†’ Response rate: 12% (leads went cold waiting)
â†’ Booking rate: 3% (unqualified leads wasting time)
â†’ Stressed, overwhelmed, couldn't scale

After automation:
â†’ 127 comments = 127 instant responses
â†’ Response rate: 67% (strike while iron is hot)
â†’ Booking rate: 28% (only qualified leads get the link)
â†’ She focuses on content, system handles conversations
â†’ Saves 10-15 hours weekly

Best part? The leads LOVE it.

"Wow, that was fast!" is now her most common first reply.

Fast response = higher perceived value = more bookings.

Your Instagram comments aren't just engagement metrics. They're hot leads waiting to be converted.

But only if you respond while they're still hot.
